author: Interview by Caroline Rees
title: Diane Abbott
text:
Abbott: ‘I love trains — a bit like Michael Portillo’ (Daniel Hambury) I couldn’t just park myself on a beach for two weeks, but I like the sunshine and to know the sea and the beach are there, so I’ve been regularly to the Caribbean. Once, in Antigua, I was by the hotel pool, swept up in being in this foreign country, and some constituents said, “Oh, hello, we’re from Hackney.” That was OK, but in the era of the camera phone, you have to be so careful what you do as an MP. That is why it’s relaxing to stay with family.
My family’s from Jamaica, and one of my best-ever Christmases was when my son, James, was little. We stayed up in the hills outside Kingston, in my uncle’s villa.
